definitions.definition: To humiliate; to disrupt somebody's composure or comfort with acting publicly or freely; to disconcert; to abash
definitions.example: The crowd's laughter and jeers embarrassed him.

definitions.definition: To hinder from liberty of movement; to impede; to obstruct.
definitions.example: The motion was advanced in order to embarrass the progress of the bill.

definitions.definition: To involve in difficulties concerning money matters; to encumber with debt; to beset with urgent claims or demands.
definitions.example: A man or his business is embarrassed when he cannot meet his pecuniary engagements.

definitions.definition: Having a feeling of shameful discomfort.
definitions.example: After returning from the pool, Aleshia felt significantly better, though she was still slightly embarrassed.
